title: Zelda no Densetsu: Fushigi no Kinomi - Jikuu no Shou
title_english: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages
title_japanese: ゼルダの伝説 ふしぎの木の実 時空の章
title_synonyms: The Legend of Zelda: Mysterious Nuts - Chapter of Space-Time
The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition
synopsis:
It has been a year since Link's visit to Hyrule Castle and the unexpected development that changed his life forever. Now a Hyrulean knight and Princess Zelda's personal guard, Link is tasked with finding the Oracle of Ages, Nayru. Accompanying him on his journey to the town of Labrynna is the princess' strong handmaid, Impa.

However, Link and Impa are unaware that their old enemies, the Twinrova, have returned with Veran, the evil Sorceress of Shadows. Veran manages to trick Link into revealing Nayru's location, allowing her to possess the Oracle of Ages and travel to the past. As Nayru's Harp of Time is the only thing left behind, Link uses it to travel through time in order to stop Veran, aided by Nayru's childhood friend Ralph and a surprising new ally.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
background: Zelda no Densetsu: Fushigi no Kinomi - Jikuu no Shou adapts the 2001 Game Boy Color game The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages. The series was published in English as The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages by VIZ Media under the VIZ Kids imprint on June 2, 2009. It was included in the complete The Legend of Zelda 10-volume box set published on October 25, 2011. The manga rereleased with Zelda no Densetsu: Fushigi no Kinomi - Daichi no Shou as the second volume of VIZ Media's The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition on January 10, 2017.
